Supression of interference light Supression of interference light Supression of interference light Supression of interference light Security Systems > Applications > Suppressing extraneous light Suppressing extraneous light In the area of video surveillance, there are often situations, where the light coming from sources in the image, impairs the video and interferes with the identification of persons or situations, or makes it impossible. Particularly in the dark, video cameras are very sensitive to disruptive highlights and changing light conditions (e.g. car headlights), which often leads to "outshone†representation of objects. In these cases, the "extraneous lights" can be suppressed by using laser lighting systems, combined with suitable video technology, so that they no longer interfere with the video recording. Security Systems > Applications > Undercover video surveillance Undercover investigation Investigating police authorities can use video surveillance systems for various purposes and under a variety of conditions. Undercover investigation During undercover investigations, it is sometimes important for the officers to illuminate at a distance of several hundred meters, in poor visibility or at night, to get a meaningful image, without being exposed. Our infrared laser illumination systems are developed especially for professional use by investigating authorities. The invisible, eye-safe laser light allows the task forces completely safe operation in public spaces. Laser safety Used for many years, they consistently fulfil the high standards of official users in of reliability, light output and user friendliness. The laser safety was confirmed by the employers' liability insurance association. The devices also help the officers with difficult tasks, such as reading number plates at night, looking through windowpanes, looking behind strong stray light or night observation. Security Systems > Products > MODAR-HDR Product description The MODAR-HDR multi-sensor system allows the monitoring and identification of people as well as the acquisition of high-definition pictures of faces, day and night. The assistance of NIR laser technology and the use of special interference filters allow the MODAR-HDR to recognise drivers in a range of up to 400 m in practically all lighting and weather conditions. The high-definition images are recorded, optimised and analysed by our software in real time. The simultaneous depiction of overview and detailed images make it possible to keep an overview of a crowd of people or a scene, while identifying individual people. The successful suppression of interfering light sources (headlamps, street lamps or sunlight for example) developed through our technology and the minimisation of atmospheric interferences are essential in many situations to obtain evidence-worthy images. For the public space and for short-range requirements, exclusively eye-safe lasers of the laser class 1 are used. For particular tasks or for long-range setups, lasers of the laser class 4 (not eye-safe) can also be used, as they allow a longer monitoring range of up to 2-3 km. MODAR-HDR Face recognition: acquisition from approx. 20 m distance Acquisition from approx. 400 m distance Telescopic mast Telescopic mast (up to 4 m above the ground) The MODAR-HDR is optimally equipped for use in vehicles (Mercedes Sprinter, VW Crafter, etc.) through the pan-tilt system with line of sight stabilisation and the solid and robust casing (protection class IP67). With its telescopic mast, the MODAR-HDR can also be extended to a height of up to 4 meters above the ground. Depending on the vehicle type and customer requirements, the MODAR-HDR can disappear completely into the emergency vehicle or return to a case on top of the vehicle roof. The construction of the vehicle, the equipment of the PC work stations in the vehicle as well as the system integration of the MODAR-HDR are conducted by OptoPrecision.
